title: Amendments to the Bribery Act to eliminate Bribery and Corruption
decision_details:
-	The approval of the Cabinet has been granted to amend to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption Act and the Laws incidental thereto, having identified the necessity of the amendments required to be made to suit the present requirements, for the elimination of bribery and corruption prevalent in Sri Lanka. Presently, action is also being taken to amend the Judicature Act to establish a three Member Bench High Court to expedite the conducting of financial crimes and corruption trials. 

Concurrently, section 70 of the Bribery Act, No.11 of 1954 has also to be amended to enable the corruption charges apart from bribery charges to be conducted not only by the Magistrate's Court but also by the High Court.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena to publish the Draft Bill prepared for the purpose in the Government Gazette and subsequently, present it in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.
